DataElement.preferredName: Whole-Brain Radiotherapy Administration Mega Volt Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the dose, in megavolts, of whole-brain radiation therapy administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of radiation treatment to the entire brain, commonly used as major component in treatment of primary and metastatic brain tumors.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Radiation treatment modality used as major component in treatment of primary and metastatic brain tumors. This is a standard treatment for multiple brain metastases.

Concepts.definition: Radiation treatment modality used as major component in treatment of primary and metastatic brain tumors. This is a standard treatment for multiple brain metastases.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the amount of radiation given in megavolts (MV) ( a quantity of one million units of electric potential and electromotive force, equal to the difference of electric potential between two points on a conducting wire carrying a constant current of one ampere when the power dissipated between the points is one watt, equivalent to the potential difference across a resistance of one ohm when one ampere of current flows through it.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A prefix indicating a quantity of one million, 10E6.:The SI derived unit of electric potential and electromotive force, equal to the difference of electric potential between two points on a conducting wire carrying a constant current of one ampere when the power dissipated between the points is one watt, equivalent to the potential difference across a resistance of one ohm when one ampere of current flows through it.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A prefix indicating a quantity of one million, 10E6.

A SI derived unit of electric potential and electromotive force, equal to the difference of electric potential between two points on a conducting wire carrying a constant current of one ampere when the power dissipated between the points is one watt, equivalent to the potential difference across a resistance of one ohm when one ampere of current flows through it.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
